# Our Vision for Adult Social Care: The Oxfordshire Way

The Oxfordshire Way strategic vision for adult social care  sets out our ambition to support people to live well and independently in their communities, remaining fit and healthy for as long as possible.

The Oxfordshire Way is a strength-based approach that acknowledges that people have their own personal strengths, networks and local community-based resources to help them lead a fulfilling life, and any additional health and social care support should build on that. 

Working in partnership with voluntary and community sector, we are actively supporting and investing in community assets to promote prevention and work collaboratively with our partners and providers (please see Section 4: Prevention for more information).

Information and advice

Providing information is another key component of delivering our vision and ensuring people can access what they want to know, opportunities in their communities and activities to make the best choices to remain healthy, and access support where needed. Our bespoke web-based directory for Oxfordshire, Live Well Oxfordshire , provides a wide range of information and support to enable people to find support in their community, including over 2,000 services, community groups, information pages and a calendar of activities across Oxfordshire. 

We regularly check and update the directory: 442 new groups/services have been added to the directory in the last 12 months. We also have a wide range of information and advice on adult social care on Adult Social Care webpages  for people and their families to help them live well and independently within their own communities.

Oxfordshire Local Account

2022-2023

# Foreword

Welcome to Oxfordshire County Council’s Local Account for 2022-2023, where we want to share some of the things that our adult social care teams are really proud of achieving over the last twelve months.

This year’s Local Account reflects a lot of hard work, but we set high standards for ourselves, and we know this record could be even better if we work closely with people we support, their families and carers, to ensure it captures information that makes it real for them. Next year’s Local Account will look different because it will be properly co-produced by people who have first-hand experience of using our services.

The available documents don't provide specific information about accessibility options such as translations or easy-read formats for accessing social care information in Oxfordshire.

**Relevant Details:**
- Oxfordshire County Council provides a **Live Well Oxfordshire guide**, which contains a wealth of information supporting the Oxfordshire Way vision. This guide is available in paper format and can be delivered free to your door or picked up at various locations such as carers’ centres, hospitals, GP surgeries, Age UK facilities, and libraries (Document 1).
- The Oxfordshire County Council's survey for carers was made available in the top five most-translated languages in the county: Polish, Sudanese Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Kurdish Sorani, and Spanish (Document 8).

**Practical Next Steps:**
- For more information or to request specific accessibility options, you may visit the Oxfordshire County Council's social care webpages at [oxfordshire.gov.uk](https://www.oxfordshire.gov.uk/residents/social-and-health-care/adult-social-care/oxfordshire-way).
- You can also contact Oxfordshire County Council directly for further assistance regarding accessibility needs.
